intro: Lagenocarpus humilis, commonly known as the lowland sedge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its morphology features triangular stems and small, scale-like leaves, typical of many sedges. Lagenocarpus humilis produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, contributing to its ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
